title: 4 Ways to Convert a WordPerfect Document to MS Word

steps.title: Open the document in WordPerfect.
steps.content: Open the document in WordPerfect. If you have WordPerfect, you can easily save your document in the Word DOCX format.

steps.title: Click File and select Save as.
steps.content: Click File and select Save as . This will let you save the WordPerfect file as a Word file.

steps.title: Select DOCX as the file format.
steps.content: Select DOCX as the file format. You can choose this option from the "File type" menu at the bottom of the window. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Save the file.
steps.content: Save the file. Type a name for your file and choose a location to save it to. Once you click Save , you'll find your new Word DOCX file at the selected location. Next to "File Type," change the file type (.doc or .docx). [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open Microsoft Word on your computer.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Word on your computer. You'll find Word in your Windows menu on a PC or in the Applications folder (macOS).

steps.title: Click the File menu and select Open.
steps.content: Click the File menu and select Open . This menu is at the top-left corner of Word.

steps.title: Browse for the document you want to convert.
steps.content: Browse for the document you want to convert. The steps to do this vary depending on your version of Word. Usually you'll have to click Browse and then open the folder that contains your WordPerfect document. WordPerfect documents end with .wpd or .doc, depending on the version.

steps.title: Select the document and click Open.
steps.content: Select the document and click Open . This opens the WordPerfect file in Microsoft Word.

steps.title: Click the File menu and select Save As.
steps.content: Click the File menu and select Save As . If this doesn't open the "Save" or "Save As" dialog box, click Browse on the menu after choosing Save As .

steps.title: Open the folder in which you want to save the file.
steps.content: Open the folder in which you want to save the file. You can save it anywhere you wish.

steps.title: Select Word document as the file type.
steps.content: Select Word document as the file type. You can do this by clicking the drop-down menu next to "Save as type" or "File format" and selecting Word document (*.docx) .

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . This document will now be saved as a new Word document, ending with the ".docx" file extension.

steps.title: Go to https://document.online-convert.com/convert-to-docx in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://document.online-convert.com/convert-to-docx in a web browser. This is a free tool called Online Convert, which you can use to convert a WordPerfect document (and various other types of files) to the Microsoft Word .docx format. There are many different options for file converters online. If you don't want to use this one, you can search for "WPD to DOCX converter." The steps on other converters should be similar.

steps.title: Click Choose Files.
steps.content: Click Choose Files . It's in the green box at the center of the screen.

steps.title: Select the WordPerfect document and click Open.
steps.content: Select the WordPerfect document and click Open . This uploads the file to the converter.

steps.title: Click Start conversion.
steps.content: Click Start conversion . It's below the green box. The file will now be converted. Once the process is complete, a download button will appear. Depending on your computer, the Save or Save As window may automatically pop up.

steps.title: Click Download if the Save window didn't appear.
steps.content: Click Download if the Save window didn't appear. It's the green button under the "Your converted file" header.

steps.title: Open the folder to which you want to save your file.
steps.content: Open the folder to which you want to save your file.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . The converted file will now download to your computer.

steps.title: Open your file in WordPerfect.
steps.content: Open your file in WordPerfect. This method will not work if you don't have WordPerfect. It's also not a time-efficient way to convert files, but it is the most reliable method.

steps.title: Copy the text.
steps.content: Copy the text. You can use keyboard shortcuts like Ctrl/Cmd + A to select all the text in the document and Ctrl/Cmd +C to copy everything.

steps.title: Open a blank document in Word.
steps.content: Open a blank document in Word. You can do this by opening Word, then going to File > New .

steps.title: Paste the text you have copied.
steps.content: Paste the text you have copied. Press Ctrl/Cmd + V to paste from your clipboard. Everything you copied, even the formatting will be pasted into the Word document, which means the formatting may make your text look like gibberish.

steps.title: Remove the formatting from your pasted text.
steps.content: Remove the formatting from your pasted text. As soon as you press the keyboard shortcut to paste, you'll notice a tooltip appears next to your cursor with "Paste Options." Click the last icon that looks like an "A" on a clipboard, which says "Keep Text Only" when you hover over it. You can also skip using the mouse to click this box and instead press Ctrl/Cmd + T . Alternatively, press Ctrl/Cmd + Alt + V to open the "Paste Special" window, then select "Unformatted Text" to paste without formatting.

steps.title: Save the Word document.
steps.content: Save the Word document. Go to File > Save or press Ctrl/Cmd + S to save your file. If your document was highly formatted in WordPerfect (like a table), you'll need to redo that formatting in Word.
